entities.name: lion
entities.description: The Lion and The Serpent is mentioned in the title, but it's not clear what this refers to. It might be a story or a mythological reference.

entities.name: serpent
entities.description: The Serpent is mentioned in the title, but like the Lion, it's not clear what this refers to. It might be a story or a mythological reference.

entities.name: golden snitch
entities.description: The Golden Snitch is described as 'tiny fluttering' and is the object of Harry's pursuit in the story. It is mentioned as being at the Slytherin end of the pitch.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is a student who is playing Quidditch and trying to catch the Golden Snitch. He is described as diving, pulling his Firebolt around, and stretching towards the Snitch.

entities.name: malfoy
entities.description: Malfoy is a student who is also playing Quidditch and trying to catch the Golden Snitch. He is described as streaking out of the sky, reaching for the Snitch, and scrabbling at Harry's hand.

entities.name: slytherin
entities.description: Slytherin is a house in the school where Harry and Malfoy are students. It is mentioned as being associated with the end of the pitch where the Golden Snitch is hovering.

entities.name: firebolt
entities.description: The Firebolt is Harry's broomstick, which he uses to play Quidditch. It is mentioned as being pulled around by Harry in his pursuit of the Golden Snitch.

relationships.description: Harry is pursuing the Golden Snitch, trying to catch it. This is described as a desperate and windswept effort.
Malfoy is also pursuing the Golden Snitch, trying to catch it. He is described as reaching for it and scrabbling at Harry's hand.
Harry and Malfoy are competing against each other to catch the Golden Snitch. This is described as a neck-and-neck competition.
